Disney's Finding Nemo jumps a full step above Toy Story and does not even compare to the original classics like Cinderella, winning an Oscar Award and Best Animated Children's movie in the 2004 Academy Awards.
I've always been a huge fan of animation but "Finding Nemo" has been, and will always be, my favorite animated film. I have yet to find another film as memorable or inspirational.
Refer to title. How do I beat the word count? Jeez, do I have to write an entire essay?
We didn't see Nemo drown damnit, the mom dies in beginning best scene it's hilarious, and I thought we were building up to see Nemo die, but no...

reviews.review_title: Finding Nemo Is The Funniest Movie Of All Times!!!!!!
reviews.content: I think is the best movie right after The Lion King. I think it was one of the funniest movies that I have seen. It had a little bit of everything. Marlin and his scary self, Dory and her very funny self and of course Nemo and his brave self.
A great song about the relationship between father and son. A must see for adults and kids!
Yeah very good. One of my favourite movies as a child.

reviews.review_title: An Absolute Experience in the Underwater World!
reviews.content: This is one movie that doesn't have any age boundaries, anyone from 2 years and above will enjoy this movie.  It's a movie that can be seen over and over again, while enjoying it more each time.  The voices of Marlin and Cory are fantastic and the beauty of the sea is simply spectacular.  I would rate this movie a 9.8/10 for overall imagery, sound and story line.Definitely, one that must be in your personal collection!
This is one of my favorite movies of all time. It is a classic Pixar movie for any one of any age. I remember seeing it in theaters and still laugh every time I watch it.

"Finding Nemo" How many children love the ocean? The ocean is a fabulous place that holds many of our creatures in the world. Take an adventure with Nemo and his friends through the adventures, and dilemmas of the ocean. You will meet some fish whose home is in the ocean. What sounds like more fun then going on a rip tide ride with a sea turtle? Or meeting a shark who doesn't eat fish anymore? If you find the ocean one of the most fascinating places on earth then "Finding Nemo" is just the movie for you."Finding Nemo" came out in 2003, and caught many children's attention. The main characters are Nemo is who the little clown fish who is lost, Marlin who is also a clown fish, looking for his son Nemo, Dory who meets Marlin during his attempt to rescue Nemo. The movie is about a cartoon clown fish fish called Nemo, who wants to prove to his friends that he is not scared and gets taken away by a scuba diver, for a tank in a dentist office. Marlin who is Nemo's father tries to rescue Nemo during the whole movie. Marlin comes across new characters such as Dory, who becomes his partner in searching for Nemo. They go on an underwater adventure to save Nemo and come face to face with sharks, sea turtles, jellyfish, and so much more. It received 81/2 stars out of 10 on the rating scale for movies. It is 100 minutes long and won an Oscar for the making of this outstanding movie. The director of this movie Andrew Stanton and the Co-director is Lee Unkrich. The cartoon characters voices in this movie are done by famous people. Just some examples the voice of Nemo is Alexander Gould, the voice of Marlin is Albert Brooks and the voice of Dory is Ellen Degeneres.This movie starts out at Nemo's coral reef home. His mother is killed in the beginning which sets the stage for his father taking care of him. Nemo goes to school on the first day. The class is taking a field trip to the drop off, which Marlin, Nemo's father is not happy about. Marlin goes to the drop off to save his son, but when he gets there he witnesses Nemo being taken away by a scuba diver. Nemo was proving to his friends that he can get the closest to a boat, and was kidnapped by a scuba diver for a dentist's fish tank at his office. Marlin decides to go on an adventure and look in the whole ocean to find Nemo. Marlin meets Dory, who is a forgetful, funny fish. She forgets things quickly, and she explains to Marlin she has short term memory. Dory decides to help Marlin find Nemo. They meet a shark called Bruce who is not eating fish anymore, they meet a sea turtle Squirt and go on a rip tide ride with the sea turtles towards where Nemo is, they come across a school of jellyfish, and a lantern fish. Nemo and Marlin come across many hardships during this movie. Now hopefully you are wondering does Marlin ever save Nemo? You will have to watch the movie and find out.I think Marlin was a determined fish and father. During the whole movie he never once said he was going to give up. Partially I think what kept Marlin going was the fact that he lost his wife and now he doesn't want to loose his son. Marlin comes face to face with a shark Bruce, who brings him back to his other two friends that are sharks. They participate in an AA meeting against eating fish. Dory bumps her nose and starts to create blood this triggers Bruce and he then wants to eat fish. Marlin runs from the shark and never gives up. Even at the end when Marlin is safe he still continues to find Nemo despite what other hardships he will encounter. This shows a child who is watching "Finding Nemo" that it is not okay to give up. That when you want to achieve a goal such as Marlin wants to rescue Nemo you should continue you're hardest even when times get tough. This movie is targeted towards children at a young age, and I think it is important to teach them never to give up even when they are not succeeding. This movie, as well as Marlin the character gives a great example that you should never give up.I thought this movie was an excellent movie for children. It teaches the children about the ocean and certain species that live in the ocean. It explains certain areas in the ocean such as a "drop off" or a "rip tide". The movie also teaches the children about these topics in a fun way. For example you go on a sea turtle ride down the rip tide. During the ride, the sea turtles are acting like they are surfing and the voices of the sea turtles change too. "Finding Nemo" also instills in young children to not give up. That you should continue to try when times get tough. In the beginning it also gives an example of why children should not go off on their own. It demonstrates that Nemo left his class and was taken away by someone that a child can relate to as a stranger. There are many lessons to be learned in the movie and they teach them in a creative way. That's why I think you should go watch "Finding Nemo" and take you kids along too. Then you can also find out if Marlin finds Nemo.

reviews.review_title: Acting great, movie not so much at times
reviews.content: The vocal talents in this film are great. I love the way Ellen DeGeneres portrayed Dory. Perfect actress. I find that, at times, the only thing keeping the movie funny is Dory. I found the plot strong but the execution weak in places. I like the movie and I've watched it a few times, but it's not a movie I'd watch over and over. It was a big hit and it'll be around for a while.I was disappointed in the way that the director chose to portray several scenes. A couple of scenes (or animated motions) are repeated in the exact same way throughout the film. If the script calls for the same text to be repeated, it's okay to repeat it, just don't repeat the entire animation.

reviews.review_title: Anybody who doesn't like this movie needs to learn to laugh!
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie tremendously.  It may be a "cartoon", but it has depth (no pun intended) and soul that many movies fail to attain.  I laughed out loud at the all-too-human emotions portrayed by the different sea creatures, and forgot I was watching an animation.  A must see for all ages.

reviews.review_title: So it's the turn of cartoons
reviews.content: So it's the turn of cartoons. It seemed to me that I watched it as a child. A kind movie about a caring dad who can't believe that he will never see his son again, and is ready to do anything to save him. And again, the essence of the plot flashes in my head, how to get rid of the fears of the past, to live in the present.But here the story is much deeper, it is possible that the main point is not to be afraid of the world, yes, there are those who will condemn you, want to eat you, but there are also those who will support and help you. Do not be afraid to leave your home, you need to travel, get into adventures, doubt everything, look for a new hobby every day, read books in different directions, go to Sochi for the weekend, try skateboarding, glue pink wallpaper with flamingos, sing on Sundays, go for mushrooms, buy new clothes of different styles, walk in Okhta Park even in the bitterest cold, take pictures, speak at a city school conference, fly to St. Petersburg for a week to see withto see your family, to do a new hairstyle, not to be afraid to express your opinion, not to be afraid to swear and shout, not to be afraid to cry, to read poems alone, never to be modest. That's life."Don't be humble. Nobody cares about you anyway, and you're also modest."

The cartoon directed by Andrew Stanton and Lee Unkrich in the United States in 2003 is still popular. This cartoon contains topical problems that will always affect children and adults. It shows the disobedience of the child growing without a mother, which led him to serious problems, but his father did not give up and went to look for him to the other end of the world, without losing hope of seeing his son. This cartoon is suitable for viewing at any age, any company and anywhere.

Finding Nemo is the best underwater animated film of all time and it will remain that way for a while. Nemo especially of all Pixar films does not shy away from the randomness and brutality of nature. Right from the get go Marlins entire family, including his partner are eaten...That's probably the darkest scene of any Pixar Studios film. Nature is brutal and so is survival. For kids movie it is a very empowering and sad scene.Nemo is mainly about bravery and love. Marlin has gone out of his way and put himself into danger to find his missing son. Marlin leaves his home and all of his friends from the coral reef and ventures into the scary open ocean where he soon meets Dory. Over and over throughout the movie, Marlin and Dory are escaping near death scenarios showing the true nature of the open ocean. Every second of their journey to find Nemo is deadly and they're never safe from the dangers of the open ocean. While most of the movie is on edge and at any given moment they could die, Pixar also shows us how beautiful the Ocean is as well and they make many friends along their journey.Pixar got everything about this movie right. The plot, the setting, the characters, voice actors. It's all executed perfectly. For a movie made in the early 2000s when 3D animation was just kicking off, Finding Nemo is a very impressive movie to say the least. So much passion and love went into this film.10/10.
I love these Disney movie and will never get too old for them. This was so colorful and beautiful. The characters are loveable and the voice actors were well chosen.

I'm one of Pixar's greatest fans, but this film was a serious disappointment (I was even looking forward to the flight!).The animation was, as you'd expected from Pixar flawless. As a scuba diver pretty well everything looked right and felt right - even the transition from reef to sandy bottom was right on the button!*However* what happened to the story/script and character development? In this respect it wasn't a patch on Pixar's other films. It fell into classic (note with a small 'c') Disney territory - simple story, great for little kids but what about us big ones?

This is a light, entertaining movie, and actually one of the best family films.A clown fish named Marlin loses his young son, Nemo, because he takes the risk of going to the open sea though he hears there are many dangers in the ocean. Nemo is unexpectedly captured by a scuba driver and thrusted in a dentist office's fish tank. Marlin meets an absent-minded fish, Dory, and they travel to rescue Nemo, meeting many troubles. On the other hand, Nemo and his tankmates try to get out of the tank before he becomes the dentist's naughty niece's new pet Although the genre is an animation, it is not a childish movie. The script is funny and touching. Moreover, the voice performance is amazing. Therefore, if you are not a native speaker, I recommend seeing this movie with subtitled version at first.

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the BEST movie EVER
reviews.content: This movie is amazing! I watch it over and over again! Its beautiful! Its not like shark tale and spongebob, in which the fish live in cities with electricity-finding nemo is totally natural! The anemone, the barracuda, the anglerfish-all that! The color was amazing, too! They did exaggerate the colors a bit (like how deb and flo are blue and white striped with a blue tail while the species they are suppost to be are black and white striped with a white tail) and they, of course, drastically exaggerated the emotions fish can feel. reviews.review_title: Right up there with Toy Story and Toy Story 2; well-animated with a good plot.
reviews.content: Finding Nemo was an excellent film, in my humble opinion, from start to finish. I walked into the theater without particularly high expectations. Since the trailers had told us absolutely nothing about the movie, I actually assumed that Dory and Marlin were man and wife (or something); I questioned how a movie of any length could be carried entirely by a fish's search for his son. I must confess that my expectations were completely exceeded. I was blown away.I'm not going to sit here and summarize the movie for you; just go watch for yourself. (133/135 favorables at RottenTomatoes.com, for the record.) But I will say this: this is not just a kid's film. I'm a 19 year old girl, and I think it's safe for me to say that theoretically I shouldn't empathize overmuch with either father or son (being a far cry from a kid aching to go to school, or a fretting mother). It was funny and exciting, following in the tradition of Pixar films, with jokes for all ages. You know you should expect the happy ending, but certain moments still make you jump and fret a little or sit at the edge of your seat.Of course, the animation was brilliant. Kudos to the CGI team and RenderMan for a job well done. The water program is very nice, the coral reef brilliant and teeming with life. The scenes from above the water were photorealistic at times. And beyond the computer animation, I'd like to offer a few thanks to the team that made the water gravity work (things fall in water, even fish; they just fall differently) and the fish move. I've hardly seen anything about it, but the movements are very realistic and follow the real patterns of fish movement (Dory swims in short spurts; "Built for speed" as she puts it; Marlin rows with his tail and uses his fins in an alternating pattern). Nemo's movement is different, as well; he swims with more of his body to make up for his bad fin. It's seamless, and thus hardly noticable.The music is whimsical and has a bit of a dreamlike quality. When Marlin loses the boat the music makes me think of a bad dream. I really love the score; I bought it today, and now I like it even better. :)Themes, themes, themes. Every movie has to have one, and the most frequent complaint seems to be that Finding Nemo's theme is shallow. I don't know much about making a good theme, but I will tell you that what theme there was acted as wonderful character development. There's bravery, friendship, and parenthood stuff going on in there. It stikes a chord partially because those on the developing team know so much about letting children grow up, since many of them have kids, too. I think the feeling the producers put into the film comes through in the film itself, anyway.On the subject of character development: If Dory was the comic relief, then Marlin was the one that carried the movie. There are those that find Marlin annoying, and those that feel Albert Brooks is undistinguished in this role (apparently Marlin is the quissential Brooks character), but while Dory made me laugh, I always wanted to know what was going to happen next with Marlin. His constant fretting just made sense to me; this is his son we're talking about after all, and Marlin is keenly aware of how much personal danger he is in when he leaves the reef. (He and Dory almost get eaten six times, if you consider that the jellyfish are indeed 'trying' to eat them.) Also, it's understated, but the fact that Marlin leaves the reef is a huge deal for him, being something of a coward; and outside their anemones, clownfish are completely defenseless. Besides, Dory really helps balance out Marlin's pessimism.Dory/Marlin interaction is funny, actually; Marlin is always the parent with these two. He has to be. And he does indeed equivocate Dory with Nemo in his mind, on some level, as demonstrated in the belly (or mouth) of the whale. But Dory teaches Marlin some things, and Marlin teaches Dory a little, and the audience is thoroughly entertained by their banter in the meantime.I thought all of the voice acting was brilliant, actually. Degeneres cracks me up. Whale scene; enough said. It apparently took her two days of speaking whale to produce all that. Albert Brooks may have been built for the role, but he's all the better for it. His voice almost breaks in all the right places. Honorable mentions go to Alexander Gould, who really managed to project himself into Nemo. One tends to forget this is a kid's voice-acting. Geoffery Rush, the pelican, is a brilliant character. I only wish there was more of him. Willem Dafoe; do I really have to say anything? Brilliant as always. Crush is voiced by Mr. Stanton himself, and all I have to say is 'Duuuude'. My friends and I have been saying "You were like, 'Woah!', and we were like, 'Woah!!', and you were like, 'wooooah'," for days now. Very, very nice.To quickly compare it to other Pixar films, I'd say this was more ambitious than any of the other films in terms of scope, and more ambitious than every film except A Bug's Life in terms of choice of protagonist. (A movie about fish. Come on!) Depending on your taste, you might like any of the other Pixar movies better, but I'll say now that if Toy Story and Toy Story 2 are my favorites, Nemo is right up there next to them.My rating: 5 out of 5. Brilliant, witty, goofy, adventurous, and even a bit suspenseful. Well done, Pixar. Well done.

There are not that many movies that I can honestly say that I've watched over and over again. This is one of them. The lines are classic, funny, and the facial expressions of the characters is priceless. Pixar has done it again! Keep up the great work and I can't wait for 'the Incredibles'Raff

reviews.review_title: Why I think this movie is horrible in terms of creativity
reviews.content: Notice I didn't say, "Why this movie sucks." I am merely stating my opinion, people. And for those of you who say the Finding Nemo message boards are for people who LIKE the movie--you are wrong. The message boards are supposed to be ABOUT the movie, and that's all. The following message DOES belong in this message board, even though it is a negative message.Why I don't like this movie (and many other CGI's): 1) Pixar: "Well we've done a movie about this, we've done a movie about that, now all we need is a movie about fish! But it won't be hard, we'll just take the themes from our other movies and put it underwater." 2) Pixar movies all have the same unoriginal puns in them, and those puns are the only reason the movies are considered funny. A fish in a Pixar movie would say, "Give me high fin!" instead of "high five." It's really unoriginal and as un-clever as "un-clever" can be. A place in a Pixar movie will say, "Give me high wing!" A Bug's Life had another awfully uncreative pun: "Shoo, fly, don't bother me." And the funny part? He said it to a fly! HAHAHAHAHAHA, get it?! Jeez, Pixar is ridiculous. Toy story and Ice Age are really the only clever ones out there that don't rely on puns for humor. Superhero Pixar movie: "Eat your vegetables so you get stronger." HAHAHAHAHAHA! He's ALREADY strong! HAHA! 3) Dory: more annoying than Chris Rock's voice, more annoying than Chris Tucker screaming at Ice Cube. More annoying than the fact that almost all of the children's movies out there today are CGI. 4) Even in the movies where the characters are HUMANS, they STILL are trying to replace regular animation. CGI art is easier than pencil; computers automate a lot of the movements of things. The artist sets a track for the fish fins to follow, for the tail to follow, for the body to follow, hits okay, and boom, you got a fish swimming.5) And again, for emphasis: same jokes as every other Pixar movie out there.

The pix-tar film Finding Nemo was one of the most entertaining movie i have seen in a long time.The film was directed by Andrew Stanton and Lee Unkrich.Finding Nemo is a cartoon so there are no real people actually in the movie besides the voices of each character. But each of the actors that did each voice did a wonderful job and should be very proud of the job they did in the film. . There are three main characters in this movie, Marlin which is the father fish, Nemo in the little kid fish, and Dory which is Martin's friend that he finds on his journey he takes. The voice of Martin in played by Albert Brooks which I thought did I great job playing the strict worried father role throughout the movie. The voice of Dory is played by Ellen DeGeneres, which is the best role in this movie. She fits the characters scrip so well it seems like she is really the fish in this movie not an actual person. Ellen keeps you laughing almost the whole movie with her voices and little side humor that some people pick up on and some don't. The last main character is Nemo the son of Martin and is played by Alexander Gould which isn't really a huge actor in the Hollywood scene but did a wonderful job in the Pixar film. His character is a little clown fish that gets lost and has to be found by his father before something else happens. The plot of finding Nemo is wrote very well by the directors. There are many parts in the movie that make you laugh your pants offand other parts that might mae a tear or two come out of your eyes. If you are bored or have a date that wants to watches a funny cartoon movie Finding Nemo is one to see. I don't think anyone in the room wouldn't want to watch the beautiful colors of the Pixtar Film.

reviews.review_title: stunning animation with intelligent story about a piece of life
reviews.content: The first time i watched 'Finding Nemo', all i could do was just laugh and laugh... 'cause you can never ever control that!!! it was a complicated feeling i felt then... and still i am amazed by the complexity that the movie has.'Finding Nemo' is a breakthrough. It's not just about celebrating the creative art work of the professionals, it's more than that. 'Finding Nemo' is a true animation with all that intelligence, taste, and all good things that come in minds of anybody around the world. I think it's like the best modern animated movie that stun people's eyes and mind.You'll never know how you can even forget about how funny dory was. I mean... all characters are also very special, unique and they build up this animation into something so much real. It's just too real that somehow it makes me think that Those fishes can talk. You know how dory's actually trying to talk with a whale... and for God's sake, she can!!!'Finding Nemo' itself really speaks. It has so much meanings that we can relate them to our lives. It's... you know... AMAZING. How Fish actually more humanity than a human itself. Hahaha... yeah, that's for sure!!!This is gonna be like 'Beauty & The Beast' that was nominated as the Best Picture at Oscar several years ago... u see how those critics comment about 'Finding Nemo'??? They give 'FN' the A grade.., almost all!!! better than they actually give to those films that's gonna be predicted to being nominated as the best picture 2004 like mystic river and master and commander.let's see how 'Finding Nemo' can lead its way to Oscar 2004!!! I bet that it's gonna take the trophy. At least for Best Animated Feature. And I hope it's gonna make steps to the Best Picture, best original screenplay, best original score and song and best art-direction/set decoration or even best director... Let's see!!!So, u agree with me???

I can't help but reckon everyone who hasn't seen it yet, just go and have great fun....cheers coolio

Finding Nemo is a great film.  It is packed with a lot of humor!  It also has some parts that can sadden children, but overall it is something that the family can enjoy.I guess some irony can make the movie interesting, like a shark on a 12-step program to become friends with fish or a pelican telling a fish to hop in it's mouth to save it's life.The movie opens up with some sad scenes, like Nemo's mother (with the eggs) getting eaten by a barracuda.  Nemo is the only child of Marlin, who is now overprotective of his son.Well, I won't spoil the movie for you, but I have heard from others that, even though it's rated G, some of the younger children did actually cry during the movie.Well, overall, it was a great movie with amazing graphics.  It's no wonder they spent a long time working on this project, but it did pay off.I rate this film a 9 out of 10.

I went to see 'Finding Nemo' with 3 of my friends and my little cousin, and we were very lucky to get tickets, but we all LOVED the movie so much.  I personally thought Dory was played very well! I would definatly see it again, and I am definatly getting it when it arrives on DVD!! I would reccommend it to anyone that wants to see a good, funny, movie!!

opening night of finding nemo.. and it rocked my socks ;-)  definitely one of pixar's best.  the story line is brand new.  the animation is incredible. the characters are unforgettable.  and the humor is spread well throughout the entire film.  i definitely recommend Finding Nemo for anyone of any age.. it has jokes for adults while at the same time being educational for kids.the only thing i was disappointed with was that there were no outtakes! :-O

This is the BEST movie from Pixar yet.  The story line was well thought out, and excellently executed.  I was worried that parts of the movie would be too intense.  However, the humor that infused the entire movie kept this from happening.  Finding Nemo is the best kind of comedy. Totally unlike so many comedies today, where you have a few really funny scenes connected by long periods of not funny.  My husband commented that this was the most continuously funny movie that he had seen in a long time.  I personally did not expect to like this movie.  I don't care for Albert Brooks, or Ellen DeGeneres, but the movie itself distracted me from who was doing the voices.My two girls, 7 & 9, loved it.  My youngest really enjoyed the scenes with the sharks, the turtles and, her favorite part, the whales.  My oldest enjoyed the way Marlon and Dorrie escaped from the sharks, and the way the movie ended.  We will be purchasing this one when it comes out on DVD.

reviews.review_title: Warning! Not just another Pixar Fun Film!
reviews.content: In  `Toy Story: we were treated to a hip, fresh view of life from the toy's point of view.  Ditto for `A Bug's Life'. `Monsters Inc' rounded out Pixar's penchant for getting inside the head of the imaginary and creating an intriguing world that.sucked us in and took as for a great ride.Enter :'Finding Nemo'.  It is here Pixar has dropped the ball.  Do we get a fresh, unique perspective of life from the Fish point of view? Nope. Fish swim, they are afraid of predators, and well, that's about it.  The ocean is a dangerous place, a theme repeated with boring redundancy throughout the film.  The plot slogs along from one anxiety invoking mishap to the next, with little humor intervening. What little humor there is comes across as weak. The scene with sharks in an AA type meeting swearing off fish as meals simply doesn't work.   I guarantee you will check your watch in the first 30 mins, then regularly thereafter.I understand kids movies are to be simple and funny, with the occasional sad parts and near misses.  This is more near misses and sad parts, and I just expected much more from Pixar in terms of story and imagination.  The animation is absolutely breathtaking, and the acting is excellent.  Too bad the underlying skeleton is so weak.I see the next Pixar film, slated for November, is `The Incredibles.'  It has a different writer, so hopefully we'll have shot at getting things up to snuff.

Yes, the movie was predictably formulaic - it's a Pixar movie for kids, what were you expecting, "Roger Rabbit"? Yes, the animation was incredible. Yes, the actors were ideal for the parts.Most importantly, the movie made me laugh and laugh. I highly recommend this movie for inner children of all ages.

I took my nephews to this movie and wasn't really expecting to be entertained myself but was surprised at how well the movie was done.  My nephews loved it and so did I.  I give two thumbs up for this movie!

reviews.review_title: The bar has been raised yet again.....
reviews.content: Just when you thought it couldn't get any better, along comes Nemo. Maybe responding to the gauntlets thrown down by DreamWorks (Shrek) and Fox (Ice Age), Disney/Pixar have come out with their most visually stunning and most emotionally moving film yet.  The humor, small details, background action, and minor characters (the gulls really cracked me up!) provide the richness that make this a definite see-again.  But maybe the best compliment is how thoroughly I forgot the CG wizardry and was drawn into the world of the characters. You don't need to know it's computer animation, it's just *animation*, and it keeps getting better all the time.Can't wait to see what those folks will come up with next....

reviews.review_title: The sharks not vegetarian, just not fish eaters?
reviews.content: One of the funnier things that I missed initially is that Bruce, a great white, Chum, a mako, and Anchor, a hammerhead are all shark species that attack people... While they may be swearing off eating fish, there is nothing to say that they aren't getting their fill off people instead.

reviews.review_title: Great film, no spoilers, just praise.
reviews.content: Finding Nemo is an excellent family movie. Far above the recent releases of "Shrek" and "Ice Age," Finding Nemo achieves the right balance of humor with tragedy. The voices fit the characters neatly and the writing is extremely sharp and innovative.My only caution would be for the extremely young child. Some scenes are dark and scary, so I would warn parents who think that a toddler should see movies in the theater. (With the exception of the Rugrats movies, children under 5 generally can't sit still long enough...)Go and see it! Now! Take the entire family, and fear not for bad language or extensive bathroom humor, just enjoy yourself! :)

I went into the movie a little suspicious because lately so many movies' highlights are the trailers, and there's nothing more!  But this one was delightful.  The humor was great, the lessons for children and parents many, the animation breathtaking.  My only concerns are a couple of "scary" moments for very small children -- even I jumped when the shark (Bruce) first appeared on the screen.  But nothing is sustained enough to cause real nightmares (I have a 23 year old who is still scared of clowns and spiders because of movies she saw ... I thought she was old enough!)  All in all, I would recommend this movie to anyone and everyone.

Finding Nemo kept me laughing for th entire show.  It was heartwarming.  I made my boyfriend come with me to see it.  He didn't want to go but he loved it.  We were among the last people to leave the theater.  The actors did a fine job.  I would recommend this flick to kids from 3-93 years of age. It was the best film I've seen in 2003!

My husband and I were probably the only ones in the theatre without children (ours are grown). I throughly enjoyed 'Finding Nemo' It was cute that most everyone had some kind of disability. Casting Ellen Degeneres as Dory was brilliant. I cracked up everytime she couldn't remember anything. ...and when she was talking 'Whale', she did it brilliantly. The subtle jokes and mannerisms were ingenious. I will never see a sea gull again without thinking of "Mine, Mine". I'm still laughing thinking about the movie.

My one line summary says it all.  Another amazing film from Pixar and Disney.  I hope that for all of our sakes they keep it up.  It would be awful to see such an amazing pair break up.  Both sides need to just kiss and make up.  It would be like life if Batman and Robin were never together or should it be better said Woody and Buzz.

The movie was great!I took my son to see it last weekend and we loved it.What did you expect?Pixar is THE movie studio in the business today. With hits, like Toy Story, A Bug's Life and Monsters, Inc., it had to be great! Right?
Well, it was.Good Job! 10/10

reviews.review_title: When will they find the fish so I can go home?
reviews.content: Unfortunately, I went into Finding Nemo with high expectations.  By the end, I left wishing I had just taken a good nap at the theater rather than waste my time (it felt like roughly 12 hours) watching this insipid flick.The movie made me smile a couple of times (mostly at the forgetful fish), and, if it had been written as a fifth grade class project, would have had an impressive plot.  The surfer turtles - lame.  Overprotective dad - boring.  The bad fin on Nemo - come on!  Any potential actual laughing the movie might have engendered was wasted by the fact that I had seen all of the funny scenes approximately 1,721 times in commercials and previews.As positive a review as I can give: "Cute film your kids might like.  Good animation"Real Review:  "Waste of time and money.  The whole family would have a much better time at the zoo watching monkeys fling poop at each other."

Took my little guys (2 & 3 years old) to see this flick and it scared the pants off them.  I am sure this movie is very enjoyable for kids that are a little older but if you do have little ones and are considering this movie - wait for the DVD or VHS and rent it.

reviews.review_title: Pixar has done it, once again...
reviews.content:
I remember when I saw the first few trailers for this, I thought that Pixar may have made a movie that wasn't up to par with the others.  However, I decided to see it, just because it was Pixar, and I hadn't yet been let down by any of their movies.  I sure was wrong in thinking that this was going to be bad!The movie starts out on a rather dramatic note, but soon, the humor kicks in, especially with the introduction of Dory.  She provides much of the humor, but it isn't just her that makes this movie great. Marlin is Nemo's overprotective dad, and he provides a bit of humor as well.  The voice acting is spot on, and Ellen Degeneres (Dory) and Albert Brooks (Marlin), do excellent jobs with these characters. What is even better is that the jokes are not just for children; they are pretty enjoyable for adults as well...(I'm a teenager, and the audience I saw this with was mainly made up of adults...without kids.)This just goes to show how great Pixar is.The computer animation is also quite stunning, from the backdrops of Sydney, Australia, to the murky look of the ocean water in some scenes.  I have to admit that I was quite impressed with several scenes in this film.
The minor characters are great as well.  The fish in the aquarium also provide for plenty of laughs.  The character of Darla, with her introduction including the 'Pyscho' shower music, was pretty interesting as well...She kind of reminded me of Sid from Toy Story.Anyway, Finding Nemo is an excellent, well-made flick, and it is probably the best movie so far from Pixar.  This is definitely one that you should catch in theaters.The best movie that I've seen so far this year....9/10

reviews.review_title: This is the best movie in the world!
reviews.content: I loved this movie. People have said that it is just for younger children but I'm 13 and I really enjoyed this movie. It was great, it was funny, it was so true, I loved it, I just loved it. I would say this movie is for all ages! For little children to teens to adults! EVERYONE! Thanks for reading; if you dont" agree then write something back. Bye

I have to disagree with mr./ms. pinstripe.  This movie was wonderful.  It is great for all ages which is apparent by the diverse age groups that was in the theater to see this film.  I definitely recommend this film for anyone ages 0-100.  A cute, CUTE movie.  I absolutely loved it.  It was very funny, and had VERY lovable characters.  THUMBS UP!!!!!!

I thought Finding Nemo was one of the best films I have ever seen. Not only did it have excellent animation but it also had a heartwarming story as well.  If one were to peel back the layers of this story, some powerful lessons in the game of life could be found.  Although the main characters are portrayed as colorful tropical fish, it is easy to apply these messages to ourselves as well.  Two lessons from this movie were especially appealing to me. The first was Marlin and the way he overcame his fear of leaving his home and losing sight of his son Nemo.  That is quite understandable, for Marlin had gone through a very tragic incident with the destruction of his mate and all but one of his eggs.  When Nemo was taken away by divers, he did not just give up and accept that he would never see his son again.  He went after his son, faced his fears, overcame enormous obstacles, and discovered the value of trust with another fish he had befriended along the way. The next lesson occurred when Nemo got stuck in the filter and Gill insisted that he get himself out.  Nemo assumed that his gimpy fin was an obstacle and would therefore make it impossible for him to get out. Also, his dad always helped him in those situations.  When Nemo got himself out, the expression was of confidence and pride.  A disability does not mean that person can do less than anyone else.  The values of trust, letting go, and facing your fears in the setting of the fascinating ocean environment, along with the comic relief of Dory, proved an ingenious way of making an excellent film. I hope viewers will take the opportunity to take the messages to help themselves grow as people.  I know I did.

Finding Nemo is an animated film created in 2003 about the father –son adventure through the mysterious wonders of the ocean and the new discoveries of the land of humans. The story begins as Nemo (voice of Alexander Gould) is the only survivor after a shark attacks his mother and the other eggs. Nemo's father takes Nemo under his fins and they begin their new life together. The story unfolds as Nemo is taken by humans from his home on the coral reef. Nemo's father Marlin (voice of Albert Brooks) sets out on his journey to find Nemo and bring him back home. Nemo becomes entrapped in a fish tank, in a dentist's office, where Nemo learns that he is the new present for the Dentist's niece. Nemo befriends the other fish and together they make the escape from the land of humans to the deep waters of the ocean once again. The battles that Marlin and his new found friend Dory (voice of Ellen DeGeneres) encounter on their journey through the dangerous waters will capture the audience's attention and will keep the kids guessing on what will happen next. The vivid colors and real life sounds create a world of imagination and fun as the audience becomes entranced with the feeling of swimming right alongside of these new found friends. Finding Nemo is a family movie that tells the tale of a father -son bond and how far someone will go to save the one they love. We see the theme of defeating all odds and overcoming all obstacles for those you love while battling hand in hand with strangers that they now call friends. We saw how Marlin and Dory survived the chase of a vicious shark and escaped the jaws of an anglerfish as they stayed determined to find and rescue Nemo from the unknown dangers of the open sea and land. The extraordinary will power of Nemo, a young fish, has overcome all the challenges that life has thrown at him and will leave an impression on many young viewers. The way that the film transitions from Marlin and Dory's journey to the journey of Nemo allows the audience to see the struggles of both audiences while keeping tabs on what is going on. It also creates the anticipation and the importance of overcoming the dangers they encounter. The fast motion allows for the audience to become involved with the multiple life threatening chases that the characters run into without making them too long for a young audience to keep attention. The elaborate colors and the sounds help the audience to become involved and really feel like they are on the journey with Nemo. The darkening of the ocean gives the impression of the deepness and the dangerous parts of the ocean that Marlin must travel to get to where he needs to go, once again seeing the perseverance of Marlin and what he is willing to do to get to Nemo.

I have come to expect entertaining and visually engaging family fare from Pixar.  "Finding Nemo" was that and more!  I was awestruck by the underwater effects.  I was touched by the story of a father searching for his son (my young son sat next to me as we watched the film). I was impressed by the vocal performances; these actors weren't simply reading lines, they were interpreting the roles.  Perhaps this film warrants only a nod of respect from 20-somethings, who acknowledge the technical accomplishments, but take it from this 40-something, this film deserves generous applause for delivering something that connects as well as entertains.  Perhaps this accounts for its staying power at the box office?

reviews.review_title: Great movie looking forward to it coming out on DVD
reviews.content:
What can I say another Disney/Pixar success. I've gotta say my favourite character is Crush. He's the one that will bring California surf talk back onto the world stage.It's great to hear real Aussie actors in a big budget animated movie. I've also gotta say that I loved how the little characters made the movie what it is such as our own local tv personality Rove McManus as one of the crabs getting off on the bubbles coming out of the sewer pipe.On such a sad day like today it's great to be able to smile just a bit. Let's never forget the people who aren't with us today.
Dude... dude...dude...P.S Sydney Harbour isn't that clean btw. Just thought I'd point that out.

reviews.review_title: Journey to the Ends of the Ocean
reviews.content: In the film "Finding Nemo", there are many scenes and events that capture the attention of any viewer of any age. The movie begins in the ocean with a clown fish and his wife. There were expecting hundreds of children together, when something tragic happens to the mom and all her baby eggs, all but one egg died. The clown fish promises to keep that baby safe no matter what and he names him Nemo. The father fish takes Nemo to school one day, and while at school Nemo gets captured by divers. The father fish searches the entire ocean looking for his son, and on his quest to find him, he makes interesting friends and learns many things about the ocean. When the father fish finally finds his son, he is being flushed down the sink because he is "belly up." Father fish decides that he has nothing else to lose, and slowly makes his way back to his home in the coral. When the movie takes a turn for the unexpected, the audience cannot help but to stay and see what happens.Directors Andrew Stanton and Lee Unkrich try to show the audience many meanings. Some of the meanings would be directed towards adults and some to younger children. One meaning that they portray very well in this movie is the meaning of family value. They show that family is important because the father was willing to go to the ends of the ocean to find his son, and he was willing to do whatever it took to find him. Another meaning which the directors portray is that determination can take us to wherever we want to be, as long as we try. In many scenes in this movie, Nemo or his dad take many risks to achieve something. They both are determined to find each other and to come home safely, and with the determination, they find success and they find out about who they are. This movie is one of the best movies that I have ever watched. I love that the movie shows a relationship with a father and a son. In most Disney movies, the relationships are between a mother and a daughter. I also enjoyed this movie because the color and images of the ocean were appealing to the eye. The vibrant colors keep a young child's attention and they also match descriptions of what the ocean really looks like. Another reason why I enjoy watching this movie is because the humor that is used can be understood by adults and by young children. I would recommend this movie to anybody who asks, and I would also tell them to be prepared to watch it numerous times.

I'm sorry but this film was disappointing! It was of course a great looking film full of eye candy, but plot wise it was little different from the past Pixar films... yet again the main character has to go and search for or find someone!!!Toy story - Search/Find our way back to Andy's home Toy story 2 - Search/Find Buzz! Bugs Life - Search/Find bugs that can help Finding Nemo - Search/Find a fish with a tiny flipperI don't know who to blame for this lack of originality... Disney or Pixar?! I have loved every film they have done so far... don't get me wrong I enjoyed Nemo for the first 10 minutes. But it just hit me how similar these films are! I kind of hate myself for realising that too, because I so wanted to enjoy this film. Instead I found my self rolling my eyes at most of the events that occurred. I'm sure this film will entertain the under 16's which is the target audience. I just wish as with the other Pixar films there would be something there to entertain the more mature crowd. I'll try and end by saying if I had to rate this film out of 10 I would give it a 6.As a little side criticism I thought Disney/Pixar missed a good opportunity to raise awareness of water pollution with this film. It made the ocean seem like a sparkling clean place, with no environment concerns. A little bit of awareness within the film would have been a nice touch.PS. After saying all this, I have to admit the gulls were some of the funniest characters I've seen in a Disney/Pixar Production.

I love Pixar movies, there great.  Well this isn't the best movie ever, it sure is good. Dory really is the funniest character, but what did you expect. The plot is good, but, as with all recet disney films, its all about comedy.

This movie should go down in history as one of the greatest animated movies of all time! I have not only seen this movie in the theater, but I also own this movie on DVD. It ranks up there with movies like Toy Story and Monsters, Inc. Not only is the movie a superb hit, but the actors who play the voices of the characters do a amazing job! Al Brooks, who plays the voice of Marlin, and Ellen Degeneres, who plays the hilarious roll of Dory, outdo any other movies in their unique and clever voice styles. If you haven't seen this movie, I highly recommend that you go see it RIGHT NOW! Rent it at Blockbuster or buy it at Wal-Mart, wherever you get it, just go and watch it NOW! Its a 12/10!! :)

It was a great movie, I went with my cousins who were 3 and 4 at the time and they loved the movie.  I thought it was great too, a true Disney movie, people of all ages like it.  My Grandma, my Aunt and Uncle, and my parents came too, we were all laughing, not at the same time, but we were all laughing!

I love that they don't only use one accent and didn't only made this movie for us americans, it has a broad span for everyone. BTW i envy those who live in Australia i've always wanted to visit there and have had a vivid fascination with the place.  I want to move there when i get older, any one that wants to chat just email me!!
This comes from my son: It is a very beautiful movies from my point of view. It is really worth seeing it. When I was younger, I used to watch it all the time, once I even saw it twice in a row.

reviews.review_title: What kind of fish is Gill?
reviews.content: My brother and I were wondering what kind of fish Gill is.  We think he's an Angelfish, but we aren't sure.  If he IS an Angelfish, what kind is he? Also, what kind of fish are Bubbles and Gurgle?  Bubbles is my absolute favorite character, he's so cute!  I would be MUCH obliged to find this out...thanks a lot!

This was a great film for parents to view, as it taught us all a lesson in letting go.  It's hard for parents, especially single parents, to let our children go out and experience the world on their own.
It was a fun and fast paced story, with many vivid characters.

Bet your wonder what I mean of Fall in Love. This movie is my all time favorite. I just love Dory, Bubbles, and Mr. Ray. On the Dvd there is a documantary called Jean-Mitchel Cousteu's exploring the reef. I saw the documentary and It made me fall in love with the ocean. Anyways, the movie rocked! Pixar's just getting better and better every movie.

This movie has been acclaimed and heralded for months now, and while it was an enjoyable movie (typical of Pixar/Disney) it wasnt the complete movie that Monsters Inc was. Nemo had many hit and miss moments, and while most of the movie was very enjoyable, so much seemed forced. Young ones will adore this movie, and it is one the whole family can enjoy8*/10*

Another Pixar beauty.  Enjoy it and don't take it too seriously as some reviewers have! If you can't see what the fuss is about, don't worry about it.  I'm sure there are those who love it...I know I enjoyed it as did my children.Didn't you just feel for poor Nemo when the dentist decided to give him to his peculiar looking daughter...she was a truly menacing little brat! As for the super cool turtles...they added a sense of calm humour to counter balance the dangerous and nervy journey through the jelly fish.  This was a movie which touched all emotions and ended with a feel good factor.  Can't be bad...can it?

Well what can I say - I'm 35 and I love the movie. Ellen DeGeneres is absolutely fantastic as Dory. I've been speaking 'Whale' to people and getting very strange looks. It's so well written. The vibrant optimism of Dory though, steals the show. I think she should be prescribed for depression!The quality of the Animation is second to none. The voices and characterizations are superb. You can't help thinking that the story could go on and on. I hope that the recent difficulties that Pixar and Disney had won't prevent a second movie.To sum up - I saw a clip in a friends house and bought the DVD on the way home. Worth every cent!

reviews.review_title: Pixar and Walt Disney's Fourth Movie
reviews.content: Finding Nemo is the fourth movie that Pixar and Walt Disney have created.  The movie was directed by Andrew Stanton and Lee Unkrich. Finding Nemo is a story about a father, Marlin (voice of Albert Brooks) and his son, Nemo (voice of Alexander Gould).As the movie opens, Marlin and his wife are staring at their unborn children. Suddenly a large predator fish appears.  As they try to protect their children, Marlin is knocked unconscious and is unable to protect his family.  When he awakes, he discovers that his wife and children are gone except for one egg.  As the story progresses, it shows that that one egg has grown and is named Nemo.  Adventure and new experiences is what Nemo longed for.  It was hard to satisfy his urges because of his overprotective father always worried that he was in danger.  One day while playing dare with his friends, Nemo ventures too close to a boat and is captured by one of the divers.  His father tries to save him, but is too late and the journey of Finding Nemo begins.The critical intentions of the writers and directors of the film were to show that always trying to protect your children can do more harm than good. They also show that the love for a child is strong and powerful thing which pushed Marlin to find his son regardless of the dangers or obstacles that would stand in his way.Things I liked about the movie were the animation, everything looked real and vibrant, and the appeal of the characters especially Dory who puts a comical twist to the movie.  I also enjoyed when the angel fish in the tank, Gill, who taught Nemo a lesson that he couldn't let his deformed fin hold him back from taking risk.  Though I thought it to be a little sad when in the beginning of the movie Nemos mother dies.  The movie its self I thought to be very cute.  I am looking forward to the next Pixar and Walt Disney movie that is produced.

If it isn't the vibrant colours of the Great Barrier Reef or the fantastic personification of the fishy characters that give the movie its amazing rating from yours truly, it would be the wonderful story line of the Daddy fish (Marlin) searching for the Baby fish (Nemo) building fabulous friendships along the way and giving the audience a fair education of the aquatic life surrounding Australia... This movie is one the most heartwarming journeys i have ever witnessed through Pixar animation, Cudos to you "Disney Pixar"... If your child has not seen 'Finding Nemo' yet then i strongly suggest you visit JB-Hi-Fi and get yourself a Blu-Ray copy of the movie.... your children will love it and i guarantee you will too.

reviews.review_title: how cinematic and dramatic elements bring out its literary elements
reviews.content: There are a number of ways that the cinematic and literary elements bring out the literary elements in "Finding Nemo." The scenery helps the viewer to identify that it is set in an ocean by using reefs and various types of fish and sharks along with the water. The lighting also helps this by the way that it shines through the water. It was kind of milky looking. Sound effects also helped the setting because there were sounds of fishes swimming through the water and engines from boats. Music helped to set the tone at various points throughout the movie by playing happy music when a great event has occured, sad music when something bad occured, and ominous sounding music when the viewer is supposed to not be sure about the outcome of a specific event. Dialogue was a huge factor in this film. Without it, there would be little symbolism, the plot would be unclear, and the character's traits would be a bit murky. In the dialogue, the characters uttered common sayings such as "I'm glad I got that off my chest," which means a problem had been solved, and they also talked about the glass being half full or half empty dilemma which was to symbolize who was the optimist and the pessimist. This was brought up when Dorrie and Marlon were trapped in the whale and the water was going down in the whale's mouth. Dorrie said that the mouth was half full, and Marlon said that it was half empty. Another type of symbolism also occured in the whale when Marlon asked "How do I taste, Moby?" That was in reference to Moby Dick, a play in which one of the main characters was a whale. Dialogue also played a huge part in helping the viewer characterize the characters. Marlon was always saying stuff to Nemo like "You're not going to be able to get out of there yourself," and he said to Dorrie that she could not speak whale. This led the viewer to characterize Marlon as an overprotective, negative father. Dorrie and Nemo, on the other hand, were always saying comments like "Yes, I can," and "Just let me do this!" This would help to characterize them as the exact opposite of Marlon- they were positive and not overbearing. Dialogue also helped the plot to advance in the movie. In the beginning, Nemo and his dad were on the way to school and they were talking about meeting sharks and sea turtles and wondering how old sea turtles were. Marlon said that he would ask the sea turtle for his age after he met the shark, and he ended up meeting both later in the film while he was looking for Nemo.  Dialogue also helped the theme because it was a positive theme, and Dorrie and Nemo  and other fish were always positive.

The movie "Finding Nemo"takes place under the coral reef of the open sea water. A clownfish named Marlin lives with his son Nemo and he tells his son about how dangerous it is in the ocean. Nemo is captured by humans and his father Marvin has to go and rescue him. He is so worried that he doesn't know what is going to happen to his only son.  The genre is an adventure comedy for families.        Nemo sets off into the ocean sea and explores what is around him. He then is abducted by humans and is netted up and taken away to the dentist office in Sydney. Meanwhile Marlin notices that Nemo has disappeared and is nowhere to be found. Marlin meets a fish named Dory who has a short term memory loss. They both travel a very big distance to search for Nemo and soon meet up with sharks, turtles and other sea creatures. While this is happening Nemo and his friends in the tank try to leave the area to go back to their original home.          In the movie it shows how each of the characters are acting like. At first the movie starts really great because it shows how Nemo didn't want to go to the first day of school and his other friends were begging for him to come with them and they sounded so excited which make them look really cute. Another part that I liked in the movie was when Marlin felt so scared when he had lost his son. I can feel of how his father felt at that time because it's a father-son relationship. Marlin showed that he really cared for Nemo instead of just saying "oh i don't care its whatever he'll come back eventually". There was one part where I disliked of how Dory was asked if she seen a boat gone by. Even though she has short term memory she could have just said she didn't see anything instead of playing and joking around with Marlin. Dory says " oh I seen a boat it went this way no it went this way", I felt like she wanted to make Marlin feel more worried instead of telling him that she didn't see anything which is really rude.          The photography in this movie is a dark background in some parts of the movie but there is also light in the movie too. I think that the photography is really great because it creates a mood where it's a calm and peaceful place. You can always see the sea creatures that are moving around the water, which makes the picture looks so beautiful. At the end of the movie, the picture shows that it's in the city and shows the people nature and the seagulls that are flying everywhere. This kind of photography makes the scene more attractive and would make the audience have a good feeling because it wouldn't be a boring scene.                 My overall reaction to this movie is that it is such a great movie! I recommend this movie for everyone to watch because it's an adventurous family movie. The world of Finding Nemo is such a pure and simple movie, with cute creatures that live under the ocean,and having lots of fun playing with each other. The music and theme also blend, very well with the movie. This movie shows a father and son relationship which would make little kids feel they should care about their loved ones and know that they are protected and never harmed. As a final thought, watching this movie with a family will absolutely make everyone smile and end the day with a warm feeling. I truly give this movie a rate 10/10!!!!

When I knew that Disney is going to stop making animated films such as Peter Pan or Aladdin, and that is going to make only films with Pixar (computer, computer, computer...), I felt sad. Disney has been with me since I was 3 or 4 and it's a pity that the great designers who work there stop doing such masterpieces. But if you see 'Finding Nemo' everything changes. I think I've never seen a film as good as this is. It's incredible how perfect the ocean and all its animals are designed: the vegetarian sharks (I love Bruce when he smells the blood!), Nemo and his father, the teacher Ray and all his pupils or the little octopus who loses ink. If you watch this film, you'll laugh, you'll feel like crying and you won't want to eat fish never in your life (at least in my case). The first thing I've said, laughing, is the biggest part of the film. In my opinion, Dory would win an Oscar for making me laugh without stopping when she starts to speak whale language or because of her loss of memory. According to the moving moments, what happens at the beginning would make anyone cry, it's very sad. And the most moving scene for me is when there are fishermen in a ship, at the end . And that's why I don't want to eat fish again!! I'm not going to say anything, just watch it! I recommend everybody to do it. You won't lose your time, trust me!!

Finding Nemo is an animated film that adds on to the list of masterpieces created by Pixar. Although the movie is known for its humorous characters, comedic scenes, and terrific underwater animation, Finding Nemo provides emotional insight to both children and adults of what is most important in life—family.What separates Finding Nemo from most animated films is the fact that it doesn't connect to just children; it is a movie in which the entire family can enjoy and learn something from. Looking at Marlin (father of Nemo), this movie can relate to adults in that it highlights the cliché quote of "never give up" as an extremely important motto to live off by, especially when speaking about something that is very important to you. When looking at Nemo, children are able to realize that during a struggle, it is important to stay positive in order to succeed and receive something good out of a situation. By attracting and connecting to people of all ages, this is why Finding Nemo was not only one of the highest-grossing animated films of all time, but also THE best-selling DVD of all time.The producers of Finding Nemo also did an excellent job in choosing the voices for the characters. Dory, another main character, plays a quirky fish who adds a vital role in the comedy part of the movie. Choosing Ellen DeGeneres, a well known comedian and talk show host, as the voice for Dory adds to the brilliance of the movie because Ellen is a natural entertainer. Andrew Stanton, the writer and director of Finding Nemo, played the voice of "Crush," a sea turtle Marlin encountered during his journey. With Crush's "surfer dude" voice and personality, he adds another source of humor in the movie with his unique qualities.The ocean is vast and very mysterious. Finding Nemo lets you see what lies below the water with brilliant colors and overwhelming sense of detail. It truly reveals that there is a whole new world that exists in our planet. It not only provides views of underwater landscapes from within the ocean, but also the fish tank setting from a fish's point of view. The vibrant colors and the amount of detail put into this animation is another reason why so many people have been drawn to this movie.Finding Nemo is more than just a movie about a father fish who loses his beloved son and his journey to find him. The audience is truly drawn into the storyline of the movie because of Marlin's persistent determination and Nemo's lovable and impressionable personality. It allows the viewers to connect emotionally to these two main characters because of the strong bond they have with each other. The movie strongly emphasizes the devotion and enduring love a parent has for his child, and the importance of these qualities during times of complications. Because of this, it shows the reason why family is among the most important things to cherish and have in your life because they are the ones who go through great risks for one another.The meaning behind the story line, humorous scenes, amount of detail, and unique characters make being disappointed at any time during the movie impossible. It is a film that the whole family will enjoy no matter how old you are. Whether it's watching it during class or at home, I will always be just as excited to watch this wonderful film as I was the first time I watched it in theaters nine years ago.

The movie "Finding Nemo" is a adorable, funny movie for kids and adults alike. The actors are great and and the animation looks some what realistic with the shimmering water. The movie. It takes you on an adventure through the ocean, showing a dad's love for his son.The actors are good and bring more life into the movie. Ellen Degeneres plays Dory, who is a fish that forgets every five minutes and is very friendly.Dory "Hey there, Mr. Grumpy Gills, when life gets you down do you wanna know what you've gotta do?".She befriends Marlin, played by Alex Brooks, he is an overprotective dad that's son has been kidnapped by humans. Both of these actors' characters contrast, which makes the movie funny and enjoyable to watch as the change for the better and become friends.In Addition, the scenery in the movie looks amazing for animation. It captures the realistic look of the ocean even though its animated. In the first scene Marlin shows his wife Cory, who is only there for a short time, their new home over looking the coral reef. The water shimmers showing the beauty of the ocean.Although, this is a great movie they could show coral a little more instead of taking her out right away. Maybe Marlin could remember her and let her go, because in about the fist couple of minutes it shows them together in there in home and then she gets taken out of the movie altogether. Furthermore, this movie is good for kids and adults. It's not to scary like some movies are for kids now, and its funny and also serious. Adults can get bored in movies that are made for kids, but this movie doesn't bore you. It can make you laugh, when Dory forgets things. It shows the characters changing throughout the movie. Henceforth, the movies characters are cute and and there are some sad parts but there are also happy and funny parts. The scary parts in this movie are not to scary and don't scare your kids. Thus, this movie is a great movie for you and your kids.Accordingly, this is over all a great movie to watch. In the future this would be a good movie to remember, because the style of movies is going to change. Would you want your children to watch something that could scare them or give them nightmares or maybe they just don't enjoy it? If you don't want that to happen, "Finding Nemo" is a good movie to watch.

This movie is one of the best I've seen. It managed to be entertaining and hilarious all the way through. Ellen DeGeneres makes a great Dory and Nicholas Bird's cute voice is just perfect for Squirt. And you gotta admire how they used real Aussie actors for parts such as the sharks (I hate fake accents). It's an entertaining, hilarious, amily film (and you don't have to have a family to enjoy it!) I think it deserved the Oscar. The DVD commentary is amusing and informational(unlike "it was great working with this person" crap).It includes an audio track and some nice visual commentary. Anyways, its a clever CGI picture. 10/10

reviews.review_title: warning: SPOILER - I liked it, despite the odd lesson being taught...
reviews.content: 1) Marlin the fish loses his wife and all his children except one (Nemo) - because they were not careful enough.2) Nemo is captured -- when he disobeys his dad and isn't careful enough.3) Marlin risks his life in an adventurous journey across the ocean to find his son -- and in the end, he decides that he lives life too carefully. (!)OK, OK, I guess I have to admit that I liked it anyway. Good animation, musical score, humor, suspense and adventure. Also, there was the good example of little Nemo not being deterred by his one-small-fin. Be sure to stay and watch the final credits which are creatively done.

reviews.review_title: Finding Nemo is a children's action that should keep their attention!
reviews.content: A good movie for both kids and adults. It kept my attention and I didn't see that there was anything that would be inappropriate for children. The movie contains a lot of familiar voices that I recognized and a few that I didn't recognize. All the characters were cute and lovable. You might have to explain the difference between Marlin and Nemo to small children, there is a small difference, but it was hard to tell, even for me. There were a bunch of adorable little tag lines like, "Fish are friends not food." "Ride some shell." This is definitely one that should go in the DVD collection at home or in a daycare!

The general plot of the story is about Marlin (Albert Brooks), who is accompanied by a rather odd fish Dory (Ellen DeGeneres), scouring the seemingly endless ocean for his lost son Nemo (Alexander Gould) who was unfortunately captured by divers and taken away.The theme of the movie essentially seems to be overcoming your fears. I feel this is the theme of the film because Marlin, even at the beginning of the movie, seems very nervous and fearful of the oceans dangers. Before Nemo was captured Marlin had always tried to protect him due to the tragic loss of his beloved Coral (Elizabeth Perkins) and the entirety of their eggs (aside from Nemo). I feel this derived a rebellious nature in Nemo which may have led to his capture in the first place. Getting back on track, Marlin overcame his fears of the ocean by battling sharks, avoiding deadly jellyfish, withstanding a barrage of exploding undersea mines, riding the EAC (East Australian Current), and various other acts of bravery and courage.By the end of the film I found that Marlin and Nemo had formed a stronger bond as father and son because they had realized each other's point of view and mixed it with their own. Nemo realized how unsafe things could be through him initially getting caught and when he tried to block the tank filtration system and kind of "tightened" up to safety. Marlin, who overcame his fears of the dangerous sea, sort of loosened up and wasn't so uptight with Nemo after he was back safely.There are many movies that share the general theme of Finding Nemo. One, ironically, is Little Nemo Adventures in Slumberland. This film is particularly old and the theme is a little more elaborate, but I chose it both for significance of theme and irony. Basically for Little Nemo the theme also refers to overcoming fear. If you don't mind looking past the finding a fish compared to stopping a dark "Pandora's box" unleashing at least.Two techniques that were used that I am particularly fond of are the color and sound. I may be a little bias towards Disney/Pixar and THX but nonetheless I like how they work. The scene that really caught my attention however was Nemo's first day of school. Getting on the teacher's back heading out to "explore" in that first person view of the reef really made me admire the beauty of the actual reef. The vivid and assorted vibrant colors captured the reality the film was trying to portray.The scene that I felt had the greatest sound impact and kind of threw every effect together at once, for the most part, was at the harbor. When Marlin and Dory found their way into the Sydney harbor I was bombarded with spectacular sea/harbor sounds ranging from buoy bells to waves crashing elegantly off the stationed boats to the seagulls cawing (not the "MINE!?" seagulls either). This scene was so vivid and real for me that I could almost feel the breeze through my hair and taste the salt in the air.Overall I enjoyed the film and even though my insight on the theme of overcoming fear may be different than many or most viewers I believed it was a significant point to make.

"What many people consider to be witty and original is what I see as imports from early Chaplin films and episodes of the Simpsons. Finding Nemo is the story of the eponymous fish, Nemo. Nemo is the only survivor of his batch after his brothers and sisters (along with his Mother) were eaten by sharks in the egg stage. However Nemo survived (albeit deformed) along with a paranoid Father.The jokes seem tired and lack any moments of stomach-rumbling chuckling but rather a series of humoured snorts. Although the main character of Nemo is likable, the other two major characters are not. Ellen Degeneres' role as Dory is so irritating that you start hoping the diver comes back and batters Dory then at least somebody will get some use out of the poorly-designed character.Although there are smart ideas it becomes jumbled up in overly-immature jokes that decrease the entertainment value. For example the sharks that are dedicated to soothing their blood lust is worth some giggles but it gets lost in the sea(pardon the pun) of poor remarks. I should have known that the immaturity and basicness of the jokes would never stop coming. I assumed there would be a 15 minute farting sequence later on."

Finding Nemo is an absolute classic in the world of animation, and for good reason. This film tells an incredibly heartwarming and emotional story that is sure to touch the hearts of viewers of all ages. From the beautiful animation to the amazing voice acting, Finding Nemo truly has it all.

The plot of Finding Nemo follows the journey of a clownfish named Marlin, who sets out to find his son Nemo after he is taken from the ocean and placed in a fish tank in a dentist's office. Along the way, Marlin meets a host of colorful and memorable characters, including the forgetful Dory, who helps him navigate the dangers of the ocean.

The animation in Finding Nemo is truly breathtaking. The underwater scenes are stunningly beautiful, and the characters are so well animated that they feel like real, living creatures. The attention to detail in the animation is simply astounding, and it's clear that a lot of love and care went into creating this film.

The voice acting in Finding Nemo is also top-notch. Albert Brooks is absolutely perfect as Marlin, bringing a perfect mix of humor and heart to the role. Ellen DeGeneres is equally fantastic as Dory, and her performance is one of the highlights of the film.

One of the things that really sets Finding Nemo apart, though, is its ability to appeal to both children and adults. While kids will love the colorful characters and the exciting adventure, adults will appreciate the film's deeper themes of family, loss, and the importance of letting go.

Overall, Finding Nemo is a true masterpiece of animation that is sure to stand the test of time. With its stunning visuals, memorable characters, and emotional story, it's a film that everyone should see at least once.

This movie is just gorgeous to look at, really the animation is just stunning, with the blue backgrounds and colourful characters. My only criticism is that although there are some very funny moments, like Doreen speaking whale(Ellen DeGeneres was born to speak whale, really she was) and Barry Humphries's shark, I don't think it is as laugh-out loud funny as Toy Story. Finding Nemo is definitely the most beautiful visually of the Pixar movies, I would certainly pick it over Cars. The music by Thomas Newman was just beautiful, and I always look out for this in a movie, and it was a delight hearing "Beyond the Sea" over the end credits. The characters are genuinely memorable, especially Doreen and Bruce. And who can forget the girl Darla, with the Psycho music?(that is really terrifying)The voice talents are very good indeed, especially Ellen DeGeneres, and I liked Willem Dafoe's Gil. Albert Brooks made a wonderfully paranoid father figure, and I loved the plot about Marlin's son Nemo being taken by divers and Marlin (a clown fish) racing to find him. That is simple, but we meet characters like the turtle, so the film is filled with fun, enough to satisfy the fussiest child. In conclusion, 9/10 for the visuals and the characters. Outstanding! Ellen DeGeneres stands out in the voice acting department, by creating a unique and memorable character in Dory. One of the best films Pixar has done, highly recommended!

In the colorful and warm tropical waters of the Great Barrier Reef, a Clown Fish named Marlin lives safe and secluded in his anemone home with his only son, Nemo. Fearful of the ocean and its unpredictable risks, he struggles to protect his son. Nemo, like all young fish, is eager to explore the mysterious reef. When Nemo is unexpectedly taken far from home and thrust into a tacky dentist's office fish tank, Marlin finds himself the unlikely hero on an epic journey to rescue his son.
